Format LogEvents as JSON

Source: R/Layout.R
LayoutJson.Rd

Format a LogEvent as JSON

Usage

x <- x$new(event_values = NULL, toJSON_args = list(auto_unbox = TRUE))
    x$format_event(event)
x$set_toJSON_args(x)
x$clone(deep = FALSE)
x$set_event_values(x)
x$set_val_names(x)
    x$toJSON_args
x$event_values
x$val_names

Creating a New Layout

Layouts are instantiated with <LayoutSubclass>$new(). For a description of the arguments to this function please refer to the Fields section.

Fields

toJSON_args

a list of values passed on to jsonlite::toJSON()

event_values

Names of the fields of the LogEvent to include in the output object.

Methods

format_event(event)

format a LogEvent

See also

read_json_lines(), http://jsonlines.org/

Other Layouts: LayoutDbi, LayoutFormat, LayoutGlue, LayoutTable, Layout

Examples


# setup a dummy LogEvent

event <- LogEvent$new(
  logger = Logger$new("dummy logger"),
  level = 200,
  timestamp = Sys.time(),
  caller = NA_character_,
  msg = "a test message",
  custom_field = "LayoutJson can handle arbitrary fields"
)

# Default settings show all event fals
lo <- LayoutJson$new()
lo$format_event(event)
#> {"level":200,"timestamp":"2019-01-10 18:08:31","logger":"dummy logger","caller":null,"msg":"a test message","custom_field":"LayoutJson can handle arbitrary fields"} 


# Values from the LogEvent can be suppressed
lo <- LayoutJson$new(
  event_values = c("level", "timestamp", "msg")
)
lo$format_event(event)
#> {"level":200,"timestamp":"2019-01-10 18:08:31","msg":"a test message"}
